div.div:
RDC - June 30, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Great update.
The contact shortcuts freeze after a while but everything else is brilliant. All the previous issues seem to be resolved. Just needs an option not to use icons that come with themes and it would be perfect. Great update. Problem is my HTC one v struggles to run it.

Matt - June 25, 2012 - HTC Thunderbolt with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Nicely done!
Super smooth, responsive and quick. The 6/12 update brought live wallpaper support AND resizable widgets--something I think we've all been waiting for.Just wish the load times were decreased. Also, still having issues reloading my backed-up configurations. But otherwise, thanks guys! It's coming along, slowly but surely. Really a great launcher now :)

Ronald - June 24, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Overpriced but awesome
Not sure it is worth the price but I love it. If they keep adding to it, it could easily be the best

Domo - June 30, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Good App
I really like this home replacement but I'd like to see some transition effects on the home pages and maybe some free themes I don't want to spend even more money after buying this and the 3D music effect doesn't work for me, also may be some different animation props.

Hannah - June 25, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Good
But lacking some aspects from the video. Please fix. Like the flag thing.

Bowman - June 24, 2012 - Motorola Photon 4G with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Functionallity and Flare
Aesthetically very pleasing and functionally straight forward. If there ever ends up being an Android Dev H.O.F, I am calling for TSFUI to be the initial inductie. P.S. devs: let us hide apps in the main drawer and TSF Shell will be PERFECT!

kevin - June 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S3 with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Great app but!!!!
Needs to fix restarting I had to back up everything, when I did the back up a lost my Widgets so I needed Starr all over again. NEEDS FIXING ASAP!!!!!!!

Los - June 24, 2012 - HTC EVO 3D with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Amazing UI
This is the best app out there. UI is smooth and I have had no flaws whatsoever! The only thing I can't figure out is how to get the map widget on my sidebar! Still a five star rating in my book! HTC evo 3d

Nicholas - June 28, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Beautifully deceiving
Amazing launcher, but jaw-dropping power consumption ruins its usability. I have an extended battery on my HTC Resound, and within a few hours with light use my phones life was down halfway, something that never occurs. Please fix this and I will use TSF regularly.

Tracy - June 24, 2012 - Motorola Atrix with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Not bad
Has a nice UI, but I don't think it's worth $17. I would also expect more updates more often for the price that's charged.

Robert - June 28, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Love it!
Been using it since day one, and I absolutely love it! Just put Jelly Bean on my phone this morning. TSF crashes when I long press an icon to move it, every time. Can't blame TSF, as this Jelly Bean isn't officially from Verizon, but you might want to look into it as I can find no other fault with Jelly Bean. Keep up the awesome job!

C.L. - June 25, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Keep going
Much much better now, keep the great work!! But: Live wallpaper slides strangely too slowly, & widgets still occasionally become invisible, & contact widget responds very poorly, or does not respond at all.

Nicholas - June 26, 2012 - Motorola Droid RAZR with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Thanks for taking my suggestion
For home button going to drawer when at home. You should mention that in the update list though. :D Still needs auto rotation.

Kerry - June 23, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Better! but....
Every time I think this is a great product I am reminded how beta it is. I've been using it since day one and each update offers Improvements, but they are not often enough to offset the frustration of using it. It force closed and all customizing was gone. Tried to restore and all it restored was blank screens. No more for me. Weeks of getting it the way I like then it's gone to start hours of reloading it. Goodbye tsf. Hello again spb. Still fc and at least 10 reloads a day. Please just make it stable.

Icelanderus - June 25, 2012 - HTC Desire with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
widgets scroll CHOPPY
Great updates!! the scollable widgets finally works, but the animation is choppy and jerky.. plz fix TNX, and keep up the great work

livetag - June 26, 2012 - HTC One X with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
folder issue
Swiping on a folder now brings up the lasso instead of 'dragging' out the contents. I really liked this feature, is it a bug? Also pressing on widgets cause the shell to reload

Dave - June 23, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Now working again - thanks
Had problems with update causing a forced close when trying to open. Emailed developer and reinstalled today and now working perfectly. Good job. Good have it up and running again and being even better

Ian - June 24, 2012 - HTC One X with version 1.5.0.03 Beta

Thanks for the update, but instead of working on organising apps alphabetical, wheres the map tab we all have been waiting for? Add one star, but still needs work!

Tony - June 24, 2012 - HTC One X with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Problem!
3 star for now, but defo could earn a 5, having problems with widgets.. when i go into settings of a widget and then back out, it comes up "tsf is loading", even when i add my own widget like "multi Toggle" when i click to turn on wifi it doesnt just turn on it loads tsf again :( same with the brightness... love the launcher though and would defo be a high 5 if the widgets worked correct :)

Shane - June 26, 2012 - Motorola Droid X2 with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Features and eye candy abound!
This launcher is the best looking one out there! The UI is a bit different from the other launchers out there, but the learning curve isn't much at all. I have used just about every launcher for Gingerbread, and find this one to be the best looking and best functioning so far. I've paid the $14.95 for SPB Shell and the $3-$4 dollars for Launcher Pro and ADW Launcher EX. I was very hesitant to pay the $16.80 for TSF, but after finally taking the plunge, I am not disappointed in the least!

Love & have given my full support to this launcher, time to say enough is enough. If you are contemplating purchasing.. Don't, at least not yet.

Also want some new animation features and maybe a lock screen of their considering the price we have for this we should get all the above mentioned and even more but so far so good

Believe me when I say "This launcher is FAST & SMOOTH!" Thanks TSFUI. You've perfected it! Absolutely the best launcher available! Should be rated "Six Stars!"

So there is some time between releases but every irritation is always an improvement and always has at least one WOW addition to it. This last update made this my favorite app hands down for Android!

I think any launchers out there cannot compete with this launcher. ( just letting you know, you gotta get used to it first before judging yourself about this launcher ;-)) This launcher keeps updating and provides us with unbelievable features that I have not yet experienced in iOS or other launchers. It is worth purchasing!!!

xploited - June 25, 2012 - Motorola Atrix with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Great update! Improved smoothness + bug fixes.
This latest update made the launcher pretty much flawlessly smooth, no matter how many widgets / home screens you are using. Really nice optimization work. Also, launcher redraw after exiting stock Music player has been fixed. This has been bugging me for months. Thank you for this vital fix and I am sure there are others I will discover.

★★YAY!!!! AWESOME UPDATES ★★

Andres - June 23, 2012 - Motorola Atrix with version 1.5.0.03 Beta
-.-
Nice update, the gallery is awesome, but the most important thing that I was waiting for was the compatibility with live wallpapers. Finally it is compatible! BUT... works horrible when you turn it on! if you use a live wallpaper the performance goes down a lot, everything moves with a horrible lag. I mean, comon man! you are a wonderfull dev, I pay a lot for this app and I don't regreat it, but I use a Motorola Atrix, 2 cores, 1gb of RAM, you can do something better! (with the live walls).

Harold - June 24, 2012 - Version 1.5.0.03 Beta
Best launcher that I've used so far!
I've gone through several launchers: Go Launcher, Nova, SPB Shell and now TSF. Which one do I prefer? TSF without any hesitation. I was on the bubble about purchasing this launcher for $16.80 considering I purchased SPB Shell for $15 several months ago, but after playing with it, I don't think I can ever go back to any of the above named launchers. SPB has a lot of eye candy but after the novelty wears off, there really isn't much functionality to many of it's features. TSF on the other hand has features that are unique yet add that add sense of real world functionality to the UI (I'm loving the "lasso" function). The screen transitions are buttery smooth. No lag on my galaxy S2 Skyrocket and this is by far the smoothest running launcher I've installed yet. I see some real potential here if the dev's keep improving it and add more features. It appears to be updated regularly unlike SPB which takes months before any updates. I'd like to make a recommendation to the dev's regarding the notepad widget. I'm hoping you add the option to type something on the notepad rather than draw. Other than that, keep up the great work! Your last update nailed it!!
